title: Fibrosing Mediastinitis: Epidemiology and Population Prevalence
short_description: Clinical document discussing the prevalence and population distribution of fibrosing mediastinitis, particularly related to histoplasmosis infection.
long_description: This clinical research document examines the epidemiological aspects of fibrosing mediastinitis (FM), a rare condition characterized by excessive healing response to fungal infections. The document provides prevalence estimates, noting that less than 1% of histoplasmosis patients develop FM, with only several hundred cases of histoplasmosis-related FM and several dozen cases of idiopathic FM estimated in the United States. It emphasizes the geographic limitation of post-histoplasmosis FM to individuals with exposure to endemic regions and highlights the rarity of this condition in the general population.
